A few weeks ago my Pennsylvania House colleagues and I wrote to Governor Wolf to ask that he deploy our Nation Guard to help President Trump secure the southern border.

After traveling to the Yuma, Arizona and seeing first-hand how overwhelmed our Border Patrol agents are, I know those resources are long overdue and urge them to be prioritized in any future appropriations measure. https://johnjoyce.house.gov/media/press-releases/joyce-opposes-package-increase-wasteful-spending …

What is more concerning is that this costly package does not allocate one dollar of the emergency funding being requested by the Department of Homeland Security to address the security and humanitarian crisis at the southern border.

This deal between the United States and Mexico is also a huge victory for farmers in my district. We need to further help those farmers by passing USMCA.

President Trump is getting results on border security, but now it is time for Congress to hold up its end of the bargain. We will never completely stop the crisis at the southern border unless Congress builds the wall and fixes the loopholes in our asylum laws.

The American people elected President Trump for his strong negotiation skills, which we saw in action this past week. Mexico's willingness to use their National Guard to diminish the conduit that their country functions as in the illegal immigration process is a significant step.
